column1: Iodine is found in: - Amiodarone (Cordarone) - Chemicals (catalysts) for photography and engraving - Dyes and inks - Lugol's solution - Pima syrup - Potassium iodide - Radioactive iodine used for certain medical tests or the treatment of thyroid disease - Tincture of iodine Note: This list may not be all inclusive.
DO NOT give these items if the person is having symptoms (such as vomiting, convulsions, or a decreased level of alertness) that make it hard to swallow.

The person may receive: - Activated charcoal - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation), and breathing machine (ventilator) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through a vein (intravenous or IV) - Laxative - Medicines to treat symptoms
Esophageal stricture (narrowing of the esophagus, the tube that carries food from the mouth to the stomach) is a possible complication.
